intro: Harnackia bisecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf harnackia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbels, adding to its ornamental appeal. Harnackia bisecta thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
